Package Datastructures.Clauses

Class BasicClauseList

java.lang.Object
Datastructures.Clauses.InputClauses
public class BasicClauseList extends Object
Created by Ohlbach on 03.09.2018.
This class contains just the absolutely essential information about clauses.
The clauses should be the original clauses from the clause source and must not be changed.
They are used to check a candidate model against the original clause set.
A clause is an integer-array [clause-number,clause-type,[min,max],literal1,...]
The clause types are:
'0': means disjunction: '0 1 3 5' means 1 or 3 or 5
'1': means and: '1 3 4 5' stands for 3 and 4 and 5.
'2': means equivalences: '2 4 5 -6' means that these three literals are equivalent.
'3': means interval '3 2 3 5 6 7 8 means between 2 and 3 literals among 5,6,7,8 are true
'4': means atleast: '3 2 4 5 6' means atleast 2 of 4,5,6 are true
'5': means atmost: '4 2 4 5 6' means atmost 2 of 4,5,6 are true
'6': means exactly: '5 2 4 5 6' means exactly 2 of 4,5,6 are true

  • Method Details

    • addClause

      public void addClause(int[] clause)
      adds a clause to the corresponding lists. Erroneous clauses are not added to the lists
      Parameters:
      clause - a clause

    • checkSyntax

      public static int[] checkSyntax(int[] clause, int predicates, String errorPrefix, StringBuilder errors, StringBuilder warnings)
      checks the clause's syntax. Syntax errors are wrong clause type or wrong literal numbers These errors are appended to syntaxErrors. Double literals are removed and a warning is added to warnings.
      Parameters:
      clause - the clause to be checked
      errorPrefix - a prefix for the warnings
      errors - for adding error messages
      warnings - for adding a warning
      Returns:
      null or the original clause

    • getStart

      private static int getStart(Connective connective)
      returns the start of the literal section in a basic clause
      Parameters:
      connective - one of the connectives
      Returns:
      the start of the literal section in a basic clause

    • falseClausesInModel

      public ArrayList<int[]> falseClausesInModel(Model model)
      computes a list of clauses which are false in a model. This indicates that something went terribly wrong. If the model is partial, clauses whose truth value is not determined are not listed.
      Parameters:
      model - a model for the literals of the clause
      Returns:
      null or a list of false clauses.

    • disjunctionIsTrue

      public static boolean disjunctionIsTrue(int[] clause, Model model)
      checks if a disjunction is entirely false in a model.
      Parameters:
      clause - a disjunctive clause
      model - a model
      Returns:
      true if all literals are false in the model and the clause is not a tautology.

    • conjunctionIsTrue

      public static boolean conjunctionIsTrue(int[] clause, Model model)
      checks if a conjunction is entirely false in a model
      Parameters:
      clause - a conjunctive clause
      model - a possibly partial model
      Returns:
      true if all literals are true in the model.

    • equivalenceIsTrue

      public static boolean equivalenceIsTrue(int[] clause, Model model)
      checks if an equivalence is false in a model
      Parameters:
      clause - an equivalence clause
      model - a model
      Returns:
      true if not either all literals are true or all literals are false in the model.

    • quantifiedIsTrue

      public static boolean quantifiedIsTrue(int[] clause, Model model)
      checks if a atleast-clause is false in a model
      Parameters:
      clause - a atleast clause [id,type,n,literal1,...]
      model - a model
      Returns:
      true if not atleast n literals are true in the model

    • intervalIsTrue

      public static boolean intervalIsTrue(int[] clause, Model model)
      checks if a atmost-clause is false in a model
      Parameters:
      clause - a atleast clause [id,type,n,literal1,...]
      model - a model
      Returns:
      true if not atleast n literals are true in the model
